citation.article-title: Alkalispirillum mobile gen. nov., spec. nov., an alkaliphilic non-phototrophic member of the Ectothiorhodospiraceae

p.s: Description of Alkalispirillum mobile sp. nov.
Alkalispirillum mobile (mo'bi.le. L.n. adj. mobile motile)
Gram-negative, spiral-shaped cells that are ~1 μm in diameter and ~3.7 μm long.
Motile by means of a single polar flagellum.
The colonies on plates, made of medium described by Imhoff (1984b; pH 9.5 and containing 2% NaCl), are circular, convex, smooth with entire margins, 1 mm in diameter, and non-pigmented.
No excretion of amylases, lipases, esterases, and proteases is observed.
Acetate, succinate, aspartate, and glucose are used as organic carbon source.
Optimal development is at 35–38°C, pH 9.0–10.0, and 6% total salts.
The predominant components of its cellular fatty acids are C18:1cis11 acid (71.43%), C16:0 acid (15.38%), C18:0 acid (6.76%), and C12:0 acid (6.43%).
The mol% G+C of its chromosomal DNA is 66.2±0.5.
